channel.title: Better indenting in Dev C++?
channel.description:
Dev C++ is my favorite C++ compiler, but is there a way to make it indent better, more like VC++? For example, after a function and I put } on it's own line, it doesn't push itself to the left to line up with the { at the beginning of the function. And I also noticed on switch statements, while loops, etc, it intents about twice as much as it should.
Is there a way I can modify how it indents?

Not a clue tbh…the only difference I see is that smart tabs use the actual tab character to indent while otheriwise spaces are used. I don’t see what that would make much of a difference though, but as long as it works
